Name: Azure.OpenAI
Description: Azure OpenAI APIs for completions and search

Enums.Name: AudioTranscriptionPlainTextFormat

AllowedValues.Name: text
AllowedValues.Description: Use a response body that is plain text containing the raw, unannotated transcription.

AllowedValues.Name: srt
AllowedValues.Description: Use a response body that is plain text in SubRip (SRT) format that also includes timing information.

AllowedValues.Name: vtt
AllowedValues.Description: Use a response body that is plain text in Web Video Text Tracks (VTT) format that also includes timing information.

Enums.Description: Defines available options for the underlying response format of output transcription information.

Enums.Name: AudioTranscriptionJsonFormat

AllowedValues.Name: json
AllowedValues.Description: Use a response body that is a JSON object containing a single 'text' field for the transcription.

AllowedValues.Name: verbose_json
AllowedValues.Description:
Use a response body that is a JSON object containing transcription text along with timing, segments, and other
metadata.

Enums.Description: Defines available options for the underlying response format of output transcription information.

Enums.Name: AudioTaskLabel

AllowedValues.Name: transcribe
AllowedValues.Description: Accompanying response data resulted from an audio transcription task.

AllowedValues.Name: translate
AllowedValues.Description: Accompanying response data resulted from an audio translation task.

Enums.Description: Defines the possible descriptors for available audio operation responses.

Enums.Name: AudioTranslationFormat

AllowedValues.Name: json
AllowedValues.Description: Use a response body that is a JSON object containing a single 'text' field for the translation.

AllowedValues.Name: verbose_json
AllowedValues.Description:
Use a response body that is a JSON object containing translation text along with timing, segments, and other
metadata.

AllowedValues.Name: text
AllowedValues.Description: Use a response body that is plain text containing the raw, unannotated translation.

AllowedValues.Name: srt
AllowedValues.Description: Use a response body that is plain text in SubRip (SRT) format that also includes timing information.

AllowedValues.Name: vtt
AllowedValues.Description: Use a response body that is plain text in Web Video Text Tracks (VTT) format that also includes timing information.

Enums.Description: Defines available options for the underlying response format of output translation information.

Enums.Name: ContentFilterSeverity

AllowedValues.Name: safe
AllowedValues.Description:
Content may be related to violence, self-harm, sexual, or hate categories but the terms 
are used in general, journalistic, scientific, medical, and similar professional contexts, 
which are appropriate for most audiences.

AllowedValues.Name: low
AllowedValues.Description:
Content that expresses prejudiced, judgmental, or opinionated views, includes offensive 
use of language, stereotyping, use cases exploring a fictional world (for example, gaming,
literature) and depictions at low intensity.

AllowedValues.Name: medium
AllowedValues.Description:
Content that uses offensive, insulting, mocking, intimidating, or demeaning language 
towards specific identity groups, includes depictions of seeking and executing harmful 
instructions, fantasies, glorification, promotion of harm at medium intensity.

AllowedValues.Name: high
AllowedValues.Description:
Content that displays explicit and severe harmful instructions, actions, 
damage, or abuse; includes endorsement, glorification, or promotion of severe 
harmful acts, extreme or illegal forms of harm, radicalization, or non-consensual 
power exchange or abuse.

Enums.Description: Ratings for the intensity and risk level of harmful content.

Enums.Name: CompletionsFinishReason

AllowedValues.Name: stopped
AllowedValues.Description: Completions ended normally and reached its end of token generation.

AllowedValues.Name: tokenLimitReached
AllowedValues.Description: Completions exhausted available token limits before generation could complete.

AllowedValues.Name: contentFiltered
AllowedValues.Description:
Completions generated a response that was identified as potentially sensitive per content
moderation policies.

AllowedValues.Name: functionCall
AllowedValues.Description: Completion ended normally, with the model requesting a function to be called.

Enums.Description: Representation of the manner in which a completions response concluded.

Enums.Name: ChatRole

AllowedValues.Name: system
AllowedValues.Description: The role that instructs or sets the behavior of the assistant.

AllowedValues.Name: assistant
AllowedValues.Description: The role that provides responses to system-instructed, user-prompted input.

AllowedValues.Name: user
AllowedValues.Description: The role that provides input for chat completions.

AllowedValues.Name: function
AllowedValues.Description: The role that provides function results for chat completions.

AllowedValues.Name: tool
AllowedValues.Description: The role that represents extension tool activity within a chat completions operation.

Enums.Description: A description of the intended purpose of a message within a chat completions interaction.

Enums.Name: FunctionCallPreset

AllowedValues.Name: auto
AllowedValues.Description:
Specifies that the model may either use any of the functions provided in this chat completions request or
instead return a standard chat completions response as if no functions were provided.

AllowedValues.Name: none
AllowedValues.Description:
Specifies that the model should not respond with a function call and should instead provide a standard chat
completions response. Response content may still be influenced by the provided function information.

Enums.Description:
The collection of predefined behaviors for handling request-provided function information in a chat completions
operation.

Enums.Name: AzureChatExtensionType

AllowedValues.Name: azureCognitiveSearch
AllowedValues.Description: Represents the use of Azure Cognitive Search as an Azure OpenAI chat extension.

Enums.Description:
A representation of configuration data for a single Azure OpenAI chat extension. This will be used by a chat
  completions request that should use Azure OpenAI chat extensions to augment the response behavior.
  The use of this configuration is compatible only with Azure OpenAI.

Enums.Name: ImageSize

AllowedValues.Name: Size256x256
AllowedValues.Description: Image size of 256x256.

AllowedValues.Name: Size512x512
AllowedValues.Description: Image size of 512x512.

AllowedValues.Name: Size1024x1024
AllowedValues.Description: Image size of 1024x1024.

Enums.Description: The desired size of the generated images. Must be one of 256x256, 512x512, or 1024x1024.

Enums.Name: ImageGenerationResponseFormat

AllowedValues.Name: Url
AllowedValues.Description: Image generation response items should provide a URL from which the image may be retrieved.

AllowedValues.Name: Base64
AllowedValues.Description: Image generation response items should provide image data as a base64-encoded string.

Enums.Description: The format in which the generated images are returned.

Enums.Name: AzureOpenAIOperationState

AllowedValues.Name: notRunning
AllowedValues.Description: The operation was created and is queued to be processed in the future.

AllowedValues.Name: running
AllowedValues.Description: The operation has started to be processed.

AllowedValues.Name: succeeded
AllowedValues.Description: The operation has successfully be processed and is ready for consumption.

AllowedValues.Name: canceled
AllowedValues.Description: The operation has been canceled and is incomplete.

AllowedValues.Name: failed
AllowedValues.Description: The operation has completed processing with a failure and cannot be further consumed.

Enums.Description: The state of a job or item.

Enums.Name: AzureCognitiveSearchQueryType

AllowedValues.Name: simple
AllowedValues.Description: Represents the default, simple query parser.

AllowedValues.Name: semantic
AllowedValues.Description: Represents the semantic query parser for advanced semantic modeling.

AllowedValues.Name: vector
AllowedValues.Description: Represents vector search over computed data.

AllowedValues.Name: vectorSimpleHybrid
AllowedValues.Description: Represents a combination of the simple query strategy with vector data.

AllowedValues.Name: vectorSemanticHybrid
AllowedValues.Description: Represents a combination of semantic search and vector data querying.

Enums.Description: The type of Azure Cognitive Search retrieval query that should be executed when using it as an Azure OpenAI chat extension.

AllowedValues.Name: json

AllowedValues.Name: verbose_json
AllowedValues.Description:
Use a response body that is a JSON object containing transcription text along with timing, segments, and other

AllowedValues.Name: text
AllowedValues.Description: Use a response body that is plain text containing the raw, unannotated transcription.

AllowedValues.Name: srt

Enums.Description: Defines available options for the underlying response format of output transcription information.

Models.Name: AudioTranscriptionOptions
Models.Description: The configuration information for an audio transcription request.

Properties.Name: AudioData
Properties.Description:
The audio data to transcribe. This must be the binary content of a file in one of the supported media formats:
 flac, mp3, mp4, mpeg, mpga, m4a, ogg, wav, webm.

Properties.Name: responseFormat
Properties.Description: The requested format of the transcription response data, which will influence the content and detail of the result.

Properties.Name: language
Properties.Description:
The primary spoken language of the audio data to be transcribed, supplied as a two-letter ISO-639-1 language code
such as 'en' or 'fr'.
Providing this known input language is optional but may improve the accuracy and/or latency of transcription.

Properties.Name: prompt
Properties.Description:
An optional hint to guide the model's style or continue from a prior audio segment. The written language of the
prompt should match the primary spoken language of the audio data.

Properties.Name: temperature
Properties.Description:
The sampling temperature, between 0 and 1.
Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.
If set to 0, the model will use log probability to automatically increase the temperature until certain thresholds are hit.

Properties.Name: InternalNonAzureModelName
Properties.Description: The model to use for this transcription request.

DerivedModels.Name: AudioTranscriptionPlainTextOptions
DerivedModels.Description: The configuration information for an audio transcription request.

Properties.Name: responseFormat
Properties.Description: The requested format of the transcription response data, which will influence the content and detail of the result.

DerivedModels.Name: AudioTranscriptionJsonOptions
DerivedModels.Description: The configuration information for an audio transcription request.

Properties.Name: responseFormat
Properties.Description: The requested format of the transcription response data, which will influence the content and detail of the result.

Models.Name: AudioTranscriptionPlainTextOptions
Models.Description: The configuration information for an audio transcription request.

Properties.Name: responseFormat
Properties.Description: The requested format of the transcription response data, which will influence the content and detail of the result.

Models.Name: AudioTranscription
Models.Description: Result information for an operation that transcribed spoken audio into written text.

Properties.Name: text
Properties.Description: The transcribed text for the provided audio data.

Properties.Name: InternalAudioTaskLabel
Properties.Description: The label that describes which operation type generated the accompanying response data.

Properties.Name: language
Properties.Description:
The spoken language that was detected in the transcribed audio data.
This is expressed as a two-letter ISO-639-1 language code like 'en' or 'fr'.

Properties.Name: duration
Properties.Description: The total duration of the audio processed to produce accompanying transcription information.

Properties.Name: segments
Properties.Description: A collection of information about the timing, probabilities, and other detail of each processed audio segment.

ElementType.Name: AudioTranscriptionSegment
ElementType.Description:
Extended information about a single segment of transcribed audio data.
Segments generally represent roughly 5-10 seconds of speech. Segment boundaries typically occur between words but not
necessarily sentences.

Properties.Name: id
Properties.Description: The 0-based index of this segment within a transcription.

Properties.Name: start
Properties.Description: The time at which this segment started relative to the beginning of the transcribed audio.

Properties.Name: end
Properties.Description: The time at which this segment ended relative to the beginning of the transcribed audio.

Properties.Name: text
Properties.Description: The transcribed text that was part of this audio segment.

Properties.Name: temperature
Properties.Description: The temperature score associated with this audio segment.

Properties.Name: AverageLogProbability
Properties.Description: The average log probability associated with this audio segment.

Properties.Name: compressionRatio
Properties.Description: The compression ratio of this audio segment.

Properties.Name: NoSpeechProbability
Properties.Description: The probability of no speech detection within this audio segment.

Properties.Name: tokens
Properties.Description: The token IDs matching the transcribed text in this audio segment.

Properties.Name: seek
Properties.Description:
The seek position associated with the processing of this audio segment.
Seek positions are expressed as hundredths of seconds.
The model may process several segments from a single seek position, so while the seek position will never represent
a later time than the segment's start, the segment's start may represent a significantly later time than the
segment's associated seek position.

Models.Name: AudioTranslationOptions
Models.Description: The configuration information for an audio translation request.

Properties.Name: AudioData
Properties.Description:
The audio data to translate. This must be the binary content of a file in one of the supported media formats:
 flac, mp3, mp4, mpeg, mpga, m4a, ogg, wav, webm.

Properties.Name: responseFormat
Properties.Description: The requested format of the translation response data, which will influence the content and detail of the result.

Properties.Name: prompt
Properties.Description:
An optional hint to guide the model's style or continue from a prior audio segment. The written language of the
prompt should match the primary spoken language of the audio data.

Properties.Name: temperature
Properties.Description:
The sampling temperature, between 0 and 1.
Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.
If set to 0, the model will use log probability to automatically increase the temperature until certain thresholds are hit.

Properties.Name: InternalNonAzureModelName
Properties.Description: The model to use for this translation request.

Models.Name: AudioTranslation
Models.Description: Result information for an operation that translated spoken audio into written text.

Properties.Name: text
Properties.Description: The translated text for the provided audio data.

Properties.Name: InternalAudioTaskLabel
Properties.Description: The label that describes which operation type generated the accompanying response data.

Properties.Name: language
Properties.Description:
The spoken language that was detected in the translated audio data.
This is expressed as a two-letter ISO-639-1 language code like 'en' or 'fr'.

Properties.Name: duration
Properties.Description: The total duration of the audio processed to produce accompanying translation information.

Properties.Name: segments
Properties.Description: A collection of information about the timing, probabilities, and other detail of each processed audio segment.

ElementType.Name: AudioTranslationSegment
ElementType.Description:
Extended information about a single segment of translated audio data.
Segments generally represent roughly 5-10 seconds of speech. Segment boundaries typically occur between words but not
necessarily sentences.

Properties.Name: id
Properties.Description: The 0-based index of this segment within a translation.

Properties.Name: start
Properties.Description: The time at which this segment started relative to the beginning of the translated audio.

Properties.Name: end
Properties.Description: The time at which this segment ended relative to the beginning of the translated audio.

Properties.Name: text
Properties.Description: The translated text that was part of this audio segment.

Properties.Name: temperature
Properties.Description: The temperature score associated with this audio segment.

Properties.Name: AverageLogProbability
Properties.Description: The average log probability associated with this audio segment.

Properties.Name: compressionRatio
Properties.Description: The compression ratio of this audio segment.

Properties.Name: NoSpeechProbability
Properties.Description: The probability of no speech detection within this audio segment.

Properties.Name: tokens
Properties.Description: The token IDs matching the translated text in this audio segment.

Properties.Name: seek
Properties.Description:
The seek position associated with the processing of this audio segment.
Seek positions are expressed as hundredths of seconds.
The model may process several segments from a single seek position, so while the seek position will never represent
a later time than the segment's start, the segment's start may represent a significantly later time than the
segment's associated seek position.

Models.Name: CompletionsOptions
Models.Description:
The configuration information for a completions request.
Completions support a wide variety of tasks and generate text that continues from or "completes"
provided prompt data.

Properties.Name: Prompts
Properties.Description: The prompts to generate completions from.

Properties.Name: maxTokens
Properties.Description: The maximum number of tokens to generate.

Properties.Name: temperature
Properties.Description:
The sampling temperature to use that controls the apparent creativity of generated completions.
Higher values will make output more random while lower values will make results more focused
and deterministic.
It is not recommended to modify temperature and top_p for the same completions request as the
interaction of these two settings is difficult to predict.

Properties.Name: NucleusSamplingFactor
Properties.Description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature called nucleus sampling. This value causes the
model to consider the results of tokens with the provided probability mass. As an example, a
value of 0.15 will cause only the tokens comprising the top 15% of probability mass to be
considered.
It is not recommended to modify temperature and top_p for the same completions request as the
interaction of these two settings is difficult to predict.

Properties.Name: InternalStringKeyedTokenSelectionBiases
Properties.Description:
A map between GPT token IDs and bias scores that influences the probability of specific tokens
appearing in a completions response. Token IDs are computed via external tokenizer tools, while
bias scores reside in the range of -100 to 100 with minimum and maximum values corresponding to
a full ban or exclusive selection of a token, respectively. The exact behavior of a given bias
score varies by model.

Properties.Name: user
Properties.Description:
An identifier for the caller or end user of the operation. This may be used for tracking
or rate-limiting purposes.

Properties.Name: ChoicesPerPrompt
Properties.Description:
The number of completions choices that should be generated per provided prompt as part of an
overall completions response.
Because this setting can generate many completions, it may quickly consume your token quota.
Use carefully and ensure reasonable settings for max_tokens and stop.

Properties.Name: LogProbabilityCount
Properties.Description:
A value that controls the emission of log probabilities for the provided number of most likely
tokens within a completions response.

Properties.Name: echo
Properties.Description:
A value specifying whether completions responses should include input prompts as prefixes to
their generated output.

Properties.Name: StopSequences
Properties.Description: A collection of textual sequences that will end completions generation.

Properties.Name: presencePenalty
Properties.Description:
A value that influences the probability of generated tokens appearing based on their existing
presence in generated text.
Positive values will make tokens less likely to appear when they already exist and increase the
model's likelihood to output new topics.

Properties.Name: frequencyPenalty
Properties.Description:
A value that influences the probability of generated tokens appearing based on their cumulative
frequency in generated text.
Positive values will make tokens less likely to appear as their frequency increases and
decrease the likelihood of the model repeating the same statements verbatim.

Properties.Name: GenerationSampleCount
Properties.Description:
A value that controls how many completions will be internally generated prior to response
formulation.
When used together with n, best_of controls the number of candidate completions and must be
greater than n.
Because this setting can generate many completions, it may quickly consume your token quota.
Use carefully and ensure reasonable settings for max_tokens and stop.

Properties.Name: InternalShouldStreamResponse
Properties.Description: A value indicating whether chat completions should be streamed for this request.

Properties.Name: InternalNonAzureModelName
Properties.Description:
The model name to provide as part of this completions request.
Not applicable to Azure OpenAI, where deployment information should be included in the Azure
resource URI that's connected to.

Models.Name: Completions
Models.Description:
Representation of the response data from a completions request.
Completions support a wide variety of tasks and generate text that continues from or "completes"
provided prompt data.

Properties.Name: id
Properties.Description: A unique identifier associated with this completions response.

Properties.Name: created
Properties.Description:
The first timestamp associated with generation activity for this completions response,
represented as seconds since the beginning of the Unix epoch of 00:00 on 1 Jan 1970.

Properties.Name: promptFilterResults
Properties.Description:
Content filtering results for zero or more prompts in the request. In a streaming request,
results for different prompts may arrive at different times or in different orders.

ElementType.Name: PromptFilterResult
ElementType.Description: Content filtering results for a single prompt in the request.

Properties.Name: promptIndex
Properties.Description: The index of this prompt in the set of prompt results

Properties.Name: contentFilterResults
Properties.Description: Content filtering results for this prompt

Type.Name: ContentFilterResults
Type.Description: Information about the content filtering category, if it has been detected.

Properties.Name: sexual
Properties.Description:
Describes language related to anatomical organs and genitals, romantic relationships,
 acts portrayed in erotic or affectionate terms, physical sexual acts, including 
 those portrayed as an assault or a forced sexual violent act against one’s will, 
 prostitution, pornography, and abuse.

Type.Name: ContentFilterResult
Type.Description: Information about filtered content severity level and if it has been filtered or not.

Properties.Name: severity
Properties.Description: Ratings for the intensity and risk level of filtered content.

Properties.Name: filtered
Properties.Description: A value indicating whether or not the content has been filtered.

Properties.Name: violence
Properties.Description:
Describes language related to physical actions intended to hurt, injure, damage, or 
kill someone or something; describes weapons, etc.

Properties.Name: hate
Properties.Description:
Describes language attacks or uses that include pejorative or discriminatory language 
with reference to a person or identity group on the basis of certain differentiating 
attributes of these groups including but not limited to race, ethnicity, nationality,
gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, religion, immigration status, ability
status, personal appearance, and body size.

Properties.Name: selfHarm
Properties.Description:
Describes language related to physical actions intended to purposely hurt, injure,
or damage one’s body, or kill oneself.

Properties.Name: error
Properties.Description:
Describes an error returned if the content filtering system is
down or otherwise unable to complete the operation in time.

Properties.Name: code
Properties.Description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

Properties.Name: message
Properties.Description: A human-readable representation of the error.

Properties.Name: target
Properties.Description: The target of the error.

Properties.Name: details
Properties.Description: An array of details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

Properties.Name: innererror
Properties.Description: An object containing more specific information than the current object about the error.

Type.Name: InnerError
Type.Description: An object containing more specific information about the error. As per Microsoft One API guidelines - https://github.com/Microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/vNext/Guidelines.md#7102-error-condition-responses.

Properties.Name: code
Properties.Description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

Properties.Name: InnerErrorObject
Properties.Description: Inner error.

Properties.Name: choices
Properties.Description:
The collection of completions choices associated with this completions response.
Generally, `n` choices are generated per provided prompt with a default value of 1.
Token limits and other settings may limit the number of choices generated.

ElementType.Name: Choice
ElementType.Description:
The representation of a single prompt completion as part of an overall completions request.
Generally, `n` choices are generated per provided prompt with a default value of 1.
Token limits and other settings may limit the number of choices generated.

Properties.Name: text
Properties.Description: The generated text for a given completions prompt.

Properties.Name: index
Properties.Description: The ordered index associated with this completions choice.

Properties.Name: contentFilterResults
Properties.Description:
Information about the content filtering category (hate, sexual, violence, self_harm), if it
has been detected, as well as the severity level (very_low, low, medium, high-scale that
determines the intensity and risk level of harmful content) and if it has been filtered or not.

Properties.Name: LogProbabilityModel
Properties.Description: The log probabilities model for tokens associated with this completions choice.

Type.Name: CompletionsLogProbabilityModel
Type.Description: Representation of a log probabilities model for a completions generation.

Properties.Name: tokens
Properties.Description: The textual forms of tokens evaluated in this probability model.

Properties.Name: TokenLogProbabilities
Properties.Description: A collection of log probability values for the tokens in this completions data.

Properties.Name: TopLogProbabilities
Properties.Description: A mapping of tokens to maximum log probability values in this completions data.

Properties.Name: TextOffsets
Properties.Description: The text offsets associated with tokens in this completions data.

Properties.Name: finishReason
Properties.Description: Reason for finishing

Properties.Name: usage
Properties.Description: Usage information for tokens processed and generated as part of this completions operation.

Type.Name: CompletionsUsage
Type.Description:
Representation of the token counts processed for a completions request.
Counts consider all tokens across prompts, choices, choice alternates, best_of generations, and
other consumers.

Properties.Name: completionTokens
Properties.Description: The number of tokens generated across all completions emissions.

Properties.Name: promptTokens
Properties.Description: The number of tokens in the provided prompts for the completions request.

Properties.Name: totalTokens
Properties.Description: The total number of tokens processed for the completions request and response.

Models.Name: ChatCompletionsOptions
Models.Description:
The configuration information for a chat completions request.
Completions support a wide variety of tasks and generate text that continues from or "completes"
provided prompt data.

Properties.Name: messages
Properties.Description:
The collection of context messages associated with this chat completions request.
Typical usage begins with a chat message for the System role that provides instructions for
the behavior of the assistant, followed by alternating messages between the User and
Assistant roles.

ElementType.Name: ChatMessage
ElementType.Description: A single, role-attributed message within a chat completion interaction.

Properties.Name: role
Properties.Description: The role associated with this message payload.

Properties.Name: content
Properties.Description: The text associated with this message payload.

Properties.Name: name
Properties.Description:
The name of the author of this message. `name` is required if role is `function`, and it should be the name of the
function whose response is in the `content`. May contain a-z, A-Z, 0-9, and underscores, with a maximum length of
64 characters.

Properties.Name: functionCall
Properties.Description: The name and arguments of a function that should be called, as generated by the model.

Type.Name: FunctionCall
Type.Description: The name and arguments of a function that should be called, as generated by the model.

Properties.Name: name
Properties.Description: The name of the function to call.

Properties.Name: arguments
Properties.Description:
The arguments to call the function with, as generated by the model in JSON format.
Note that the model does not always generate valid JSON, and may hallucinate parameters
not defined by your function schema. Validate the arguments in your code before calling
your function.

Properties.Name: AzureExtensionsContext
Properties.Description:
Additional context data associated with a chat message when requesting chat completions using compatible Azure
  OpenAI chat extensions. This includes information like the intermediate data source retrievals used to service a
  request.
  This context information is only populated when using Azure OpenAI with chat extensions capabilities configured.

Type.Name: AzureChatExtensionsMessageContext
Type.Description:
A representation of the additional context information available when Azure OpenAI chat extensions are involved
  in the generation of a corresponding chat completions response. This context information is only populated when
  using an Azure OpenAI request configured to use a matching extension.

Properties.Name: messages
Properties.Description:
The contextual message payload associated with the Azure chat extensions used for a chat completions request.
  These messages describe the data source retrievals, plugin invocations, and other intermediate steps taken in the
  course of generating a chat completions response that was augmented by capabilities from Azure OpenAI chat
  extensions.

Properties.Name: functions
Properties.Description: A list of functions the model may generate JSON inputs for.

ElementType.Name: FunctionDefinition
ElementType.Description: The definition of a caller-specified function that chat completions may invoke in response to matching user input.

Properties.Name: name
Properties.Description: The name of the function to be called.

Properties.Name: description
Properties.Description:
A description of what the function does. The model will use this description when selecting the function and
interpreting its parameters.

Properties.Name: parameters
Properties.Description: The parameters the functions accepts, described as a JSON Schema object.

Properties.Name: functionCall
Properties.Description:
Controls how the model responds to function calls. "none" means the model does not call a function,
and responds to the end-user. "auto" means the model can pick between an end-user or calling a function.
 Specifying a particular function via `{"name": "my_function"}` forces the model to call that function.
 "none" is the default when no functions are present. "auto" is the default if functions are present.

UnionItemTypes.Name: FunctionName
UnionItemTypes.Description:
A structure that specifies the exact name of a specific, request-provided function to use when processing a chat
completions operation.

Properties.Name: name
Properties.Description: The name of the function to call.

Properties.Name: maxTokens
Properties.Description: The maximum number of tokens to generate.

Properties.Name: temperature
Properties.Description:
The sampling temperature to use that controls the apparent creativity of generated completions.
Higher values will make output more random while lower values will make results more focused
and deterministic.
It is not recommended to modify temperature and top_p for the same completions request as the
interaction of these two settings is difficult to predict.

Properties.Name: NucleusSamplingFactor
Properties.Description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature called nucleus sampling. This value causes the
model to consider the results of tokens with the provided probability mass. As an example, a
value of 0.15 will cause only the tokens comprising the top 15% of probability mass to be
considered.
It is not recommended to modify temperature and top_p for the same completions request as the
interaction of these two settings is difficult to predict.

Properties.Name: InternalStringKeyedTokenSelectionBiases
Properties.Description:
A map between GPT token IDs and bias scores that influences the probability of specific tokens
appearing in a completions response. Token IDs are computed via external tokenizer tools, while
bias scores reside in the range of -100 to 100 with minimum and maximum values corresponding to
a full ban or exclusive selection of a token, respectively. The exact behavior of a given bias
score varies by model.

Properties.Name: user
Properties.Description:
An identifier for the caller or end user of the operation. This may be used for tracking
or rate-limiting purposes.

Properties.Name: ChoiceCount
Properties.Description:
The number of chat completions choices that should be generated for a chat completions
response.
Because this setting can generate many completions, it may quickly consume your token quota.
Use carefully and ensure reasonable settings for max_tokens and stop.

Properties.Name: StopSequences
Properties.Description: A collection of textual sequences that will end completions generation.

Properties.Name: presencePenalty
Properties.Description:
A value that influences the probability of generated tokens appearing based on their existing
presence in generated text.
Positive values will make tokens less likely to appear when they already exist and increase the
model's likelihood to output new topics.

Properties.Name: frequencyPenalty
Properties.Description:
A value that influences the probability of generated tokens appearing based on their cumulative
frequency in generated text.
Positive values will make tokens less likely to appear as their frequency increases and
decrease the likelihood of the model repeating the same statements verbatim.

Properties.Name: InternalShouldStreamResponse
Properties.Description: A value indicating whether chat completions should be streamed for this request.

Properties.Name: InternalNonAzureModelName
Properties.Description:
The model name to provide as part of this completions request.
Not applicable to Azure OpenAI, where deployment information should be included in the Azure
resource URI that's connected to.

Properties.Name: InternalAzureExtensionsDataSources
Properties.Description:
The configuration entries for Azure OpenAI chat extensions that use them.
  This additional specification is only compatible with Azure OpenAI.

ElementType.Name: AzureChatExtensionConfiguration
ElementType.Description:
A representation of configuration data for a single Azure OpenAI chat extension. This will be used by a chat
  completions request that should use Azure OpenAI chat extensions to augment the response behavior.
  The use of this configuration is compatible only with Azure OpenAI.

Properties.Name: type
Properties.Description:
The label for the type of an Azure chat extension. This typically corresponds to a matching Azure resource.
  Azure chat extensions are only compatible with Azure OpenAI.

Properties.Name: parameters
Properties.Description:
The configuration payload used for the Azure chat extension. The structure payload details are specific to the
  extension being configured.
  Azure chat extensions are only compatible with Azure OpenAI.

Models.Name: ChatCompletions
Models.Description:
Representation of the response data from a chat completions request.
Completions support a wide variety of tasks and generate text that continues from or "completes"
provided prompt data.

Properties.Name: id
Properties.Description: A unique identifier associated with this chat completions response.

Properties.Name: created
Properties.Description:
The first timestamp associated with generation activity for this completions response,
represented as seconds since the beginning of the Unix epoch of 00:00 on 1 Jan 1970.

Properties.Name: choices
Properties.Description:
The collection of completions choices associated with this completions response.
Generally, `n` choices are generated per provided prompt with a default value of 1.
Token limits and other settings may limit the number of choices generated.

ElementType.Name: ChatChoice
ElementType.Description:
The representation of a single prompt completion as part of an overall chat completions request.
Generally, `n` choices are generated per provided prompt with a default value of 1.
Token limits and other settings may limit the number of choices generated.

Properties.Name: message
Properties.Description: The chat message for a given chat completions prompt.

Properties.Name: index
Properties.Description: The ordered index associated with this chat completions choice.

Properties.Name: finishReason
Properties.Description: The reason that this chat completions choice completed its generated.

Properties.Name: InternalStreamingDeltaMessage
Properties.Description: The delta message content for a streaming response.

Properties.Name: contentFilterResults
Properties.Description:
Information about the content filtering category (hate, sexual, violence, self_harm), if it
has been detected, as well as the severity level (very_low, low, medium, high-scale that
determines the intensity and risk level of harmful content) and if it has been filtered or not.

Properties.Name: promptFilterResults
Properties.Description:
Content filtering results for zero or more prompts in the request. In a streaming request,
results for different prompts may arrive at different times or in different orders.

Properties.Name: usage
Properties.Description: Usage information for tokens processed and generated as part of this completions operation.

Models.Name: ImageGenerationOptions
Models.Description: Represents the request data used to generate images.

Properties.Name: prompt
Properties.Description: A description of the desired images.

Properties.Name: ImageCount
Properties.Description: The number of images to generate (defaults to 1).

Properties.Name: size
Properties.Description: The desired size of the generated images. Must be one of 256x256, 512x512, or 1024x1024 (defaults to 1024x1024).

Properties.Name: responseFormat
Properties.Description:
The format in which image generation response items should be presented.
  Azure OpenAI only supports URL response items.

Properties.Name: user
Properties.Description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help to monitor and detect abuse.

Models.Name: BatchImageGenerationOperationResponse
Models.Description: A polling status update or final response payload for an image operation.

Properties.Name: id
Properties.Description: The ID of the operation.

Properties.Name: created
Properties.Description: A timestamp when this job or item was created (in unix epochs).

Properties.Name: expires
Properties.Description: A timestamp when this operation and its associated images expire and will be deleted (in unix epochs).

Properties.Name: result
Properties.Description: The result of the operation if the operation succeeded.

Type.Name: ImageGenerations
Type.Description: The result of the operation if the operation succeeded.

Properties.Name: created
Properties.Description: A timestamp when this job or item was created (in unix epochs).

Properties.Name: data
Properties.Description: The images generated by the operator.

ElementType.Name: ImageLocation
ElementType.Description: An image response item that provides a URL from which an image may be accessed.

Properties.Name: url
Properties.Description: The URL that provides temporary access to download the generated image.

ElementType.Name: ImagePayload
ElementType.Description: An image response item that directly represents the image data as a base64-encoded string.

Properties.Name: base64Data
Properties.Description: The complete data for an image represented as a base64-encoded string.

Properties.Name: status
Properties.Description: The status of the operation

Properties.Name: error
Properties.Description: The error if the operation failed.

Models.Name: EmbeddingsOptions
Models.Description:
The configuration information for an embeddings request.
Embeddings measure the relatedness of text strings and are commonly used for search, clustering,
recommendations, and other similar scenarios.

Properties.Name: user
Properties.Description:
An identifier for the caller or end user of the operation. This may be used for tracking
or rate-limiting purposes.

Properties.Name: InternalNonAzureModelName
Properties.Description:
The model name to provide as part of this embeddings request.
Not applicable to Azure OpenAI, where deployment information should be included in the Azure
resource URI that's connected to.

Properties.Name: input
Properties.Description:
Input texts to get embeddings for, encoded as a an array of strings.
Each input must not exceed 2048 tokens in length.

Unless you are embedding code, we suggest replacing newlines (\n) in your input with a single space,
as we have observed inferior results when newlines are present.

Models.Name: Embeddings
Models.Description:
Representation of the response data from an embeddings request.
Embeddings measure the relatedness of text strings and are commonly used for search, clustering,
recommendations, and other similar scenarios.

Properties.Name: data
Properties.Description: Embedding values for the prompts submitted in the request.

ElementType.Name: EmbeddingItem
ElementType.Description: Representation of a single embeddings relatedness comparison.

Properties.Name: embedding
Properties.Description:
List of embeddings value for the input prompt. These represent a measurement of the
vector-based relatedness of the provided input.

Properties.Name: index
Properties.Description: Index of the prompt to which the EmbeddingItem corresponds.

Properties.Name: usage
Properties.Description: Usage counts for tokens input using the embeddings API.

Type.Name: EmbeddingsUsage
Type.Description: Measurement of the amount of tokens used in this request and response.

Properties.Name: promptTokens
Properties.Description: Number of tokens sent in the original request.

Properties.Name: totalTokens
Properties.Description: Total number of tokens transacted in this request/response.

Models.Name: AzureCognitiveSearchIndexFieldMappingOptions
Models.Description: Optional settings to control how fields are processed when using a configured Azure Cognitive Search resource.

Properties.Name: TitleFieldName
Properties.Description: The name of the index field to use as a title.

Properties.Name: UrlFieldName
Properties.Description: The name of the index field to use as a URL.

Properties.Name: FilepathFieldName
Properties.Description: The name of the index field to use as a filepath.

Properties.Name: ContentFieldNames
Properties.Description: The names of index fields that should be treated as content.

Properties.Name: ContentFieldSeparator
Properties.Description: The separator pattern that content fields should use.

Properties.Name: VectorFieldNames
Properties.Description: The names of fields that represent vector data.

Models.Name: AzureCognitiveSearchChatExtensionConfiguration
Models.Description:
A specific representation of configurable options for Azure Cognitive Search when using it as an Azure OpenAI chat
extension.

Properties.Name: type
Properties.Description:
The type label to use when configuring Azure OpenAI chat extensions. This should typically not be changed from its
default value for Azure Cognitive Search.

Properties.Name: SearchEndpoint
Properties.Description: The absolute endpoint path for the Azure Cognitive Search resource to use.

Properties.Name: SearchKey
Properties.Description: The API admin key to use with the specified Azure Cognitive Search endpoint.

Properties.Name: indexName
Properties.Description: The name of the index to use as available in the referenced Azure Cognitive Search resource.

Properties.Name: FieldMappingOptions
Properties.Description: Customized field mapping behavior to use when interacting with the search index.

Properties.Name: DocumentCount
Properties.Description: The configured top number of documents to feature for the configured query.

Properties.Name: queryType
Properties.Description: The query type to use with Azure Cognitive Search.

Properties.Name: ShouldRestrictResultScope
Properties.Description: Whether queries should be restricted to use of indexed data.

Properties.Name: semanticConfiguration
Properties.Description: The additional semantic configuration for the query.

Properties.Name: embeddingEndpoint
Properties.Description: When using embeddings for search, specifies the resource URL from which embeddings should be retrieved.

Properties.Name: embeddingKey
Properties.Description: When using embeddings, specifies the API key to use with the provided embeddings endpoint.

Clients.Name: OpenAIClient
Clients.Description: Azure OpenAI APIs for completions and search

Operations.Name: getAudioTranscriptionAsPlainText
Operations.Description:
Gets transcribed text and associated metadata from provided spoken audio data. Audio will be transcribed in the
written language corresponding to the language it was spoken in.

Parameters.Name: endpoint
Parameters.Description:
Supported Cognitive Services endpoints (protocol and hostname, for example:
https://westus.api.cognitive.microsoft.com).

Parameters.Name: deploymentId
Parameters.Description: Specifies either the model deployment name (when using Azure OpenAI) or model name (when using non-Azure OpenAI) to use for this request.

Parameters.Name: AudioTranscriptionPlainTextOptions
Parameters.Description: The configuration information for an audio transcription request.

Operations.Name: getAudioTranscriptionAsResponseObject
Operations.Description:
Gets transcribed text and associated metadata from provided spoken audio data. Audio will be transcribed in the
written language corresponding to the language it was spoken in.

Parameters.Name: deploymentId
Parameters.Description: Specifies either the model deployment name (when using Azure OpenAI) or model name (when using non-Azure OpenAI) to use for this request.

Parameters.Name: contentType
Parameters.Description: The content type for the operation. Always multipart/form-data for this operation.

Parameters.Name: AudioTranscriptionJsonOptions
Parameters.Description: The configuration information for an audio transcription request.

Operations.Name: getAudioTranslationAsPlainText
Operations.Description: Gets English language transcribed text and associated metadata from provided spoken audio data.

Parameters.Name: deploymentId
Parameters.Description: Specifies either the model deployment name (when using Azure OpenAI) or model name (when using non-Azure OpenAI) to use for this request.

Parameters.Name: AudioTranslationOptions
Parameters.Description: The configuration information for an audio translation request.

Operations.Name: getAudioTranslationAsResponseObject
Operations.Description: Gets English language transcribed text and associated metadata from provided spoken audio data.

Parameters.Name: deploymentId
Parameters.Description: Specifies either the model deployment name (when using Azure OpenAI) or model name (when using non-Azure OpenAI) to use for this request.

Parameters.Name: contentType
Parameters.Description: The content type for the operation. Always multipart/form-data for this operation.

Parameters.Name: AudioTranslationOptions
Parameters.Description: The configuration information for an audio translation request.

Operations.Name: getCompletions
Operations.Description:
Gets completions for the provided input prompts.
Completions support a wide variety of tasks and generate text that continues from or "completes"
provided prompt data.

Parameters.Name: deploymentId
Parameters.Description: Specifies either the model deployment name (when using Azure OpenAI) or model name (when using non-Azure OpenAI) to use for this request.

Parameters.Name: CompletionsOptions
Parameters.Description:
The configuration information for a completions request.
Completions support a wide variety of tasks and generate text that continues from or "completes"
provided prompt data.

Operations.Name: getChatCompletions
Operations.Description:
Gets chat completions for the provided chat messages.
Completions support a wide variety of tasks and generate text that continues from or "completes"
provided prompt data.

Parameters.Name: deploymentId
Parameters.Description: Specifies either the model deployment name (when using Azure OpenAI) or model name (when using non-Azure OpenAI) to use for this request.

Parameters.Name: ChatCompletionsOptions
Parameters.Description:
The configuration information for a chat completions request.
Completions support a wide variety of tasks and generate text that continues from or "completes"
provided prompt data.

Operations.Name: getChatCompletionsWithAzureExtensions
Operations.Description:
Gets chat completions for the provided chat messages.
This is an Azure-specific version of chat completions that supports integration with configured data sources and
other augmentations to the base chat completions capabilities.

Parameters.Name: deploymentId
Parameters.Description: Specifies either the model deployment name (when using Azure OpenAI) or model name (when using non-Azure OpenAI) to use for this request.

Parameters.Name: ChatCompletionsOptions
Parameters.Description:
The configuration information for a chat completions request.
Completions support a wide variety of tasks and generate text that continues from or "completes"
provided prompt data.

Operations.Name: beginAzureBatchImageGeneration
Operations.Description: Starts the generation of a batch of images from a text caption

Parameters.Name: ImageGenerationOptions
Parameters.Description: Represents the request data used to generate images.

Headers.Name: Operation-Location
Headers.Description: The location for monitoring the operation state.

Operations.Name: getEmbeddings
Operations.Description: Return the embeddings for a given prompt.

Parameters.Name: deploymentId
Parameters.Description: Specifies either the model deployment name (when using Azure OpenAI) or model name (when using non-Azure OpenAI) to use for this request.

Parameters.Name: EmbeddingsOptions
Parameters.Description:
The configuration information for an embeddings request.
Embeddings measure the relatedness of text strings and are commonly used for search, clustering,
recommendations, and other similar scenarios.
